title: Understanding the Null Hypothesis
text: The null hypothesis is a fundamental part of statistical hypothesis testing. It's an initial statement suggesting no effect or no difference, and it helps determine whether there is enough evidence to reject that statement

title: Statistical Testing Explained
text: Statistical testing allows researchers to use data to support or refute a hypothesis. It helps validate research findings by determining the likelihood that the observed pattern is due to chance.

title: Clarifying Random Chance
text: In the context of the null hypothesis, 'random chance' is the possibility that the observed results in an experiment occurred purely by coincidence. It implies that no actual impact or relationship exists beyond mere happenstance.
